job_title: Senior Associate Director in Athens, OH

review_title: Bad place almost went out of business
pros: Many of the instructors are very nice. They have good knowledge and care for their students
cons: The new management is destroying the school. The Brenner boys has sold out the students and employees. All they care about is themselves, don’t think they ever worked a day in their life. Many employees have dedicated their career to the school only to be showing the door. They were within a few weeks of being closed down and only for the sake of a investor were they able to continue. Bad management, bed ownership. Once was a great school, now a rundown building with old equipment and non-caring management

pros: A firm that always needs employees.
cons: No advancement opportunities. Good ol boys club members only. IF jobs are posted, its extremely rare to get an interview. Extreme lack of resources. Training aids have reached their respective usefulness. are very outdated or in very horrible condition due to the lack of resources invested back into the programs. Employee division is epic. When the PowerSports School was moved to Cleveland from N. randall its demise has been imminent. Managers come and go. Students and staff are housed in an old steel facility.  Most of it appears to be storage? It doesnt really LOOK like a training facility.  No heat provided in the winter, so im told and have heard customers bringing in blankets while in class. Students state they feel isolated from main campus activities because staff will not come to their bldg because of the condition etc. employee reviews for performance are out the window. They just do not happen. Raises are poor. Always the lowest percentage possible. Never reflects cost of living etc... management is doing well tho. Nothing Ethical about OTC. It is a self serving entity that is consuming and profits without putting back into its programs. For profit organization. An excellent example.

review_title: Great learning experience, but the school needs growth.
pros: Getting to know and watching the students grow.
cons: Frequent firing without reasoning. It’s difficult to get a pay raise, and health insurance isn’t the best.

This place is a ripoff for both students and employees.  Charging a ridiculous tuition for an education in which you can top out at $19-20/hour.  OTC is known to falsify it's career placement numbers in order for it's prospective students to continue to get loans.  Then guess what, the government is on the hook for that money because very few of the students are able to pay the money back with the crappy jobs they get.  Employees are treated like garbage, THE WORST place I've ever worked.
